com.topjohnwu.superuser

Class Shell.Async

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.topjohnwu.superuser.Shell.Async
  • Enclosing class:
    Shell

    public static final class Shell.Async
extends Object
    High level API for asynchronous operations

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Shell.Async.Callback
      The callback when an asynchronous shell operation is done.

      • loadScript

        public static void loadScript(List<String> output,
                              List<String> error,
                              Shell.Async.Callback callback,
                              InputStream in)
        Get a shell with Shell.getShell(GetShellCallback) and call Shell.loadInputStream(List, List, Shell.Async.Callback, InputStream).
        See Also:
        Shell.loadInputStream(List, List, Shell.Async.Callback, InputStream)

      • loadScript

        public static void loadScript(Shell.Async.Callback callback,
                              InputStream in)
        Equivalent to 
        output = new ArrayList<String>(); loadScript(output, REDIRECT_STDERR ? output : null, callback, in).

        This method is useful if you only need a callback after the script finish running.

        Note: when the Shell.Async.Callback.onTaskResult(List, List) of the callback is called, the second parameter will always be null. If Shell.FLAG_REDIRECT_STDERR is set, the output of STDERR will be stored in the first parameter.

      • sh

        public static void sh(List<String> output,
                      List<String> error,
                      Shell.Async.Callback callback,
                      String... commands)
        Get a shell with Shell.getShell(GetShellCallback) and call Shell.run(List, List, Shell.Async.Callback, String...).
        See Also:
        Shell.run(List, List, Shell.Async.Callback, String...)

      • sh

        public static void sh(List<String> output,
                      List<String> error,
                      String... commands)
        Equivalent to sh(output, error, null, commands).

      • sh

        public static void sh(List<String> output,
                      String... commands)
        Equivalent to 
        sh(output, REDIRECT_STDERR ? output : null, null, commands).

      • sh

        public static void sh(Shell.Async.Callback callback,
                      String... commands)
        Equivalent to 
        output = new ArrayList<String>(); sh(output, REDIRECT_STDERR ? output : null, callback, commands).

        This method is useful if you only need a callback after the commands are done.

      • sh

        public static void sh(String... commands)
        Equivalent to sh(null, null, null, commands).

      • su

        public static void su(List<String> output,
                      List<String> error,
                      Shell.Async.Callback callback,
                      String... commands)
        Equivalent to sh(List, List, Callback, String...) with root access check before running.
